textBeforeTable: Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Total Liabilities for the fiscal year that ended in Jan. 2015 is calculated as Total liabilities are the liabilities that the company has to pay others. It is a part of the balance sheet of a company that shareholders do not own, and would be obligated to pay back if the company liquidated. Definition Wal-Mart Stores Inc's annual total liabilities increased from Jan. 2013 ($126,762.00 Mil) to Jan. 2014 ($128,496.00 Mil) but then declined from Jan. 2014 ($128,496.00 Mil) to Jan. 2015 ($122,312.00 Mil). Wal-Mart Stores Inc's quarterly total liabilities declined from Oct. 2014 ($128,780.00 Mil) to Jan. 2015 ($122,312.00 Mil) but then increased from Jan. 2015 ($122,312.00 Mil) to Apr. 2015 ($124,173.00 Mil). textAfterTable: Total Liabilities = Total Assets (A: Jan. 2015 ) - Total Shareholders Equity (A: Jan. 2015 ) = 203706 - 81394 = 122,312 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Total Liabilities for the quarter that ended in Apr. 2015 is calculated as Total Liabilities = Total Current Liabilities + (Total Long Term Liabilities) = Total Current Liabilities + (Long-Term Debt + Other Long-Term Liab. = 69624 + (42964 + 0 + NonCurrentDeferredLiabilities + PensionAndRetirementBenefit + Minority Interest) + 8169 + 0 + 3416) = 124,173 Total Liabilities = Total Assets (Q: Apr. 2015 ) - Total Shareholders Equity (Q: Apr. 2015 ) = 200747 - 76574 = 124,173 * All numbers are in millions except for per share data and ratio.
